snippet: The electronics maker named a new president as part of a reorganization aimed at returning the company to profitability.
abstract: Japanese electronics maker Sharp names Kozo Takahashi its new president, reshuffling top management to help restore profitability after reporting record loss; Sharp's net loss of 545.4 billion yen ($5.3 billion) in fiscal year ending in March exceeded its forecasts, compared with 376 billion yen net loss in previous fiscal year.
lead_paragraph: The electronics maker named a new president as part of a reorganization aimed at returning the company to profitability.

headline.main: After a Record Loss, Sharp Reshuffles Its Management
